Welcome.title: Welcome to calibrew!
Welcome.header: Calibrew helps you dial in your espresso machine by automatically recommending optimized settings.

instructions.title: First things first:
instructions.step2: Fill up your grinder with coffee
instructions.step3: Put the portafilter on your scale and tare it

Roast.title: Roast
Roast.description: Let's start by setting your coffee's roast level and dosage. You can find the roast level information on the packaging of your coffee beans.

Grinder.title: Grinder
Grinder.description: Now it's time to setup your grind settings. Inspect your grinder and fill out the values below.

type.title: Grinder Type
type.help:
How do you adjust the grind size on your grinder?
• Continuous - Stepless adjustment, such as a wheel you can spin, but without numbers on it
• Stepped - Fixed positions, for example numbers from 1 to 40
• Click-based - Counted by clicks, typical for handheld grinders

stepSize.title: Step Size
stepSize.help: The smallest adjustment you can make on your grinder

unit.title: Unit
unit.help: Does your grinder use numbers or letters as its unit of measurement?

finest.title: Finest Setting
finest.help: The smallest/finest grind setting on your grinder (usually 1 or A)

coarsest.title: Coarsest Setting
coarsest.help: The largest/coarsest grind setting on your grinder (e.g. 40 or Z)

clicks.description: We'll provide adjustments in terms of clicks from your current position.

Inputs.title: Dial In Your Shot
Inputs.header: What settings did you use for your last brew?

waiting.title: Waiting for results
waiting.description: Extract your first shot, fill in the results and hit calibrew.
